43
CONDITIONS FOR THE VALIDITY OF A DISINHERITANCE
(1) A testator intending to disinherit an heir must express this in the will in an indisputable manner; it is also helpful if he or she states the reason for the disinheritance.
(2) The reason for the disinheritance shall be given when the will is made, and the reason stated in point 3 of Article 42 also when the testator dies.
(3) If there is a dispute about the basis for a disinheritance, the reason for the disinheritance must be proved by the one who refers to the disinheritance.
